column8: Lovely cricket ground in wrong place
column11: wonderful cricket ground. ground structure will remind you lords cricket ground. nice looking pavilion. unfortunately we did not have any international cricket matches in this ground. Ground located very far from Hambantota city. If this ground would have been built in city area, this will be one of finest ground in Sri Lanka
Opened for Internatinal cricket, this stadium is worth a look.   The ground looks well maintained.    Not much activity except when the cricket season starts
Mahinda Rajapaksa International Cricket Stadium is the best cricket stadium in sri lanka. but dont know how  to use it there people, its a future part of the heart in hambantota

column8: Oh what a waste in the name of Cricket !
column11: A magnificent cricket stadium built to perfection is decaying. We were all sad to see the absolute waste in public property. The stadium is closed we could enter through a side gate. Although the stadium is built to play international cricket it has not being used for almost two years. Light bulbs are removed from the sockets; taps are removed from wash basins. The whole stadium is taken over by pigeons who have left their mark on all the chairs. The place is stinking and decaying, it will take a very long time to bring it back to standard to play an international game of cricket. Then again what for the Stadium is located in the bush. It may not be possible to find hundred spectators to come to watch a match from nearby. Why should people from Colombo travel all that way to watch a match? There was a match being played on the Sunday we visited the place. I was not surprised that there was no one to watch it. We understood that the facility is being looked after by an armed force unit. To their credit the ground is kept well. Actually, this a place that one should visit to understand what a colossal waste this whole thing is.
The stadium has a capacity of 35,000 people. Excellent venue for International class cricket. Good facilities too.

column8: Sooriyawewa just round the corner from Hambanthota.
column11: The proposal for a new International Cricket Stadium at Sooriyawewa was part of the government's programme to develop sports in the Southern Province of Sri Lanka as part of the government's plan to transform Hambantota into the second major urban hub of Sri Lanka, away from Colombo. The following 2011 Cricket World Cup matches were held at Hambantota International Cricket Stadium in February, 2011. The first official international match was between Sri Lanka and Canada on 20 February 2011, which Sri Lanka won by 210 runs. Two matches were played at the venue during the World Cup.
large cricket ground. good to cricket lovers. very rarely raining.35000 pax can accommodate.huge and nice.

column8: Mahinda Rajapaksa International Cricket Stadium Migahajandura Suriyaweva Hambantota Sri Lanka
column11: Mahinda Rajapaksa International Cricket Stadium Migahajandura Suriyaweva Hambantota Sri Lanka. which has hosted 23 international ICC matches so far. The next match due is on the 26th of July 2015 with Pakistan and Sri Lanka which is scheduled to start at 0230pm Sri Lanka Time. Udawalawe national park and Yala national parks are very close to the stadium and there are few small hotels also in the area. Seating capacity is 26000 and tickets are available at the gates during matches, Ticket prices start from Rs 100 up to Rs 3000.00
